latest courses.title: Framework to Choose the Right LLM for your Business
latest courses.description: This course provides a comprehensive framework for selecting the right LLM for your business. Learn to evaluate LLMs based on accuracy, cost, scalability, and more, while exploring real-world applications to make informed, strategic AI decisions.
curriculum: Framework to Choose the Right LLM
target_audience: Business leaders seeking to implement AI-driven solutions efficiently.
Data scientists exploring LLMs for industry-specific applications.
Tech professionals involved in AI integration and decision-making processes.

faqs.question: What factors are key in choosing an LLM?
faqs.answer: Key factors include accuracy, cost, scalability, technical compatibility, support, security, and compliance with privacy laws.

faqs.question: Are all LLMs suitable for the same tasks?
faqs.answer: No, different LLMs are suited to different tasks depending on the business problem and required capabilities.

key_takeaways: Understand how to evaluate and select the right LLM for business needs.
Learn to assess LLMs based on accuracy, cost, scalability, and integration.
Gain insights into real-world LLM applications through case studies.
Develop practical decision-making skills for LLM adoption in various industries.

Projects.title: Twitter Sentiment Analysis
Projects.description: Learn Sentiment Analysis using Python, which is widely used in natural language processing. Understand how to analyze emotions in text, categorize sentiments, and apply the knowledge to various domains, including customer feedback and social media analysis.
topics: Story Generation and Visualization from Tweets
prerequisites: Basic Python and Jupyter Notebook knowledge

Projects.title: Top Data Science Projects for Analysts and Data Scientists
Projects.description: A collection of open-source data science projects covering various domains such as machine learning, computer vision, deep learning, natural language processing, and reinforcement learning. Projects.description: Learn Git and GitHub essentials to manage your data science projects with version control. Understand how Git tracks project changes, collaborate efficiently, and contribute to open-source projects.

Projects.title: Loan Prediction Practice Problem (Using Python)
Projects.description: This course is designed for people who want to solve binary classification problems. The course tackles a real-life case study of Dream Housing Finance, which automates the loan eligibility process based on customer details. By the end of the course, you will have a solid understanding of classification problems and various approaches to solve them.
topics: Getting the system ready and loading the data
Model Building: Logistic Regression using stratified k-folds cross validation
Projects.additional_notes: This course assumes familiarity with Python and Jupyter Notebook. The course is free and does not offer placement support.

Projects.title: Big Mart Sales Prediction Using R
Projects.description: In this course, you will work on the Big Mart Sales Prediction Challenge, addressing a real-life regression problem. The course helps you understand the techniques required to solve regression problems using R, covering various models and approaches to prediction.
topics: Model Building: Linear Regression, Regularized Linear Regression, Random Forest, XGBoost
Projects.additional_notes: This course is free of charge and can be taken at your own pace. The course does not include placement support.

instructor.name: Vikas Agrawal
instructor.title: Senior Principal Data Scientist at Oracle Analytics Cloud
instructor.bio: Vikas Agrawal is a Senior Principal Data Scientist at Oracle Analytics Cloud, focused on designing and deploying AI solutions across ERP, SCM, HCM, CX, and MFG for Fusion and NetSuite customers. His research involves developing intelligent agents that leverage domain knowledge to solve complex problems by combining tools and critiqued LLMs/LMMs for hypothesis generation and task orchestration. An electrical engineer turned computer scientist, Vikas is an IIT Delhi graduate with experience at CalTech, Intel, and Infosys.

faq.question: What is an agentic system?
faq.answer: An agentic system refers to an AI-based structure where agents can autonomously perform tasks, often in collaboration, to solve complex problems.

faq.question: Is this course suitable for beginners?
faq.answer: Yes, this course is beginner-friendly and provides an introduction to agentic systems and their applications.

faq.question: Are there any practical demos in the course?
faq.answer: Yes, you will see practical demos that illustrate how agents are created and used in real-world applications.

faq.question: What will I learn from this course?
faq.answer: You'll gain foundational knowledge of AI agents, enabling you to apply these concepts to automation, AI development, and other tech projects involving intelligent systems.

key_takeaways: Understand the evolution and current capabilities of agentic systems.
Learn the basics of agents and multi-agent systems, including their role in solving complex problems.
Gain insights into practical applications of agents and how they function in real-world scenarios.

instructor.name: Dipanjan Sarkar
instructor.title: Head of Community and Principal AI Scientist, Analytics Vidhya
instructor.bio: Dipanjan Sarkar is a distinguished Lead Data Scientist, Published Author, and Consultant, having a decade of extensive expertise in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Generative AI, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing. His leadership spans Fortune 100 enterprises to startups, crafting end-to-end data products and pioneering Generative AI upskilling programs. A seasoned mentor, Dipanjan advises a diverse clientele, from novices to C-suite executives and PhDs, across Advanced Analytics, Product Development, and Artificial Intelligence. His recognitions include 'Top 10 Data Scientists in India, 2020,' '40 under 40 Data Scientists, 2021,' 'Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning, 2019,' and 'Top 50 AI Thought Leaders, Global AI Hub, 2022,' alongside global accolades and a Google Champion Innovator title in Cloud AI/ML, 2022.

faq.question: What prior knowledge do I need for this course?
faq.answer: A basic understanding of AI/ML principles is needed, along with some experience in machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow. Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) concepts will be helpful but not mandatory.

faq.question: Does this course include practical exercises?
faq.answer: Yes, the course provides practical, hands-on exercises through demos and notebooks. You’ll have opportunities to implement RAG systems and experiment with real-world use cases, focusing on improving retrieval and generation tasks.

faq.question: What tools do I need for this course?
faq.answer: You’ll need access to Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and relevant libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, and vector databases. The course will guide you through setting up the necessary environment for practicing the techniques.

faq.question: How is this course different from other AI/ML courses?
faq.answer: Unlike general AI/ML courses, this course zeroes in on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, addressing practical challenges like hallucinations, retrieval errors, and context optimization, with a strong emphasis on real-world applications.

faq.question: What advanced techniques are covered in this course?
faq.answer: Yes, the course covers advanced techniques like hyperparameter tuning, chunking strategies, embedding models, context compression, and agentic RAG systems, giving you the tools to build and optimize high-performing RAG systems.

key_takeaways: Master RAG systems with a solid grasp of architecture and components.
Solve key challenges like missing content and hallucinations.
Optimize performance with advanced chunking and retrieval strategies.
Develop practical decision-making skills for LLM adoption in various industries.

instructor.name: Rohan Rao
instructor.title: Principal Data Scientist, H2O.ai; Quadruple Kaggle Grandmaster
instructor.bio: Rohan Rao is a Principal Data Scientist at H2O.ai and an IIT-Bombay alumnus, a quadruple Kaggle Grandmaster, and a former #1 ranked professional on Analytics Vidhya. He is also a 9-time National Sudoku Champion, passionate about coding, reading, and writing.

faq.question: What factors should I consider when choosing an LLM?
faq.answer: Key factors include the LLM's accuracy, cost, scalability, technical compatibility, support, security, and compliance with privacy laws. The decision-making framework ensures the chosen LLM aligns with specific business requirements.

faq.question: Are all LLMs suitable for all tasks?
faq.answer: No, different LLMs are suited to different tasks. Selecting the right LLM depends on the specific business problem, required capabilities, and available resources.

faq.question: Why is accuracy important when choosing an LLM?
faq.answer: Accuracy is crucial, especially in fields like healthcare and education. LLMs must perform reliably across datasets, ensuring consistency and stability in results for critical business applications.

faq.question: What decisions should I make when selecting an LLM for healthcare?
faq.answer: Key decisions include choosing an LLM fine-tuned for medical data, ensuring accuracy, maintaining privacy, and complying with healthcare regulations.

faq.question: Can open-source LLMs be viable alternatives?
faq.answer: Yes, open-source LLMs, like Llama3, can be viable alternatives, especially when customized to specific business needs. They are catching up with closed-source options in performance.

key_takeaways: Understand how to evaluate and select the right LLM for business needs.
Learn to assess LLMs based on accuracy, cost, scalability, and integration.
Gain insights into real-world LLM applications through case studies.
Develop practical decision-making skills for LLM adoption in various industries.

Machine learning cources.title: Machine Learning Certification Course for Beginners
Machine learning cources.description: In this free machine learning certification course, you will learn Python, the basics of machine learning, how to build machine learning models, and feature engineering techniques to improve the performance of your machine learning models.
topics: Python libraries like Numpy, Pandas, etc. to analyze your data efficiently.
Importance of Statistics and Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in the data science field.
Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, and Decision Trees for building machine learning models.
How to solve Classification and Regression problems using machine learning.
How to evaluate your machine learning models using the right evaluation metrics.
Improve and enhance your machine learning model’s accuracy through feature engineering.
Machine learning cources.prerequisites: This course requires no prior knowledge of Data Science or any tool.
